## vision\_v1.Schema$Word interface

A word representation.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface Schema$Word 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [boundingBox](./vision.vision_v1.schema_word.boundingbox.md) | [Schema$BoundingPoly](./vision.vision_v1.schema_boundingpoly.md) | The bounding box for the word. The vertices are in the order of top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left. When a rotation of the bounding box is detected the rotation is represented as around the top-left corner as defined when the text is read in the 'natural' orientation. For example: \* when the text is horizontal it might look like: 0\-\-\--1 \| \| 3\-\-\--2 \* when it's rotated 180 degrees around the top-left corner it becomes: 2\-\-\--3 \| \| 1\-\-\--0 and the vertex order will still be (0, 1, 2, 3). |
|  [confidence](./vision.vision_v1.schema_word.confidence.md) | number \| null | Confidence of the OCR results for the word. Range \[0, 1\]. |
|  [property](./vision.vision_v1.schema_word.property.md) | [Schema$TextProperty](./vision.vision_v1.schema_textproperty.md) | Additional information detected for the word. |
|  [symbols](./vision.vision_v1.schema_word.symbols.md) | [Schema$Symbol](./vision.vision_v1.schema_symbol.md)<!-- -->\[\] | List of symbols in the word. The order of the symbols follows the natural reading order. |
